title: Introduction to EDI Daily Checks - What and Why
text: Every normal working week day, the checks listed below are done. This is because (@Fahim - why - what's the reason for this, and impact if we don't?) a b Fahim: I have discussed it with Jacob and it was concluded that there are no EDI daily checks involved. Jacob receives an excel file with status report that all the stores have received their sales data or not. In any case,the customer itself also contacts on the same day and inform that which location is missing sales data. According to Jacob,if a store has missed data for today due to some reasons,it should be read out anyway in the next run following the coming night. In case,if a store is missing their sales figures so a ticket needs to be created for it and it should be send to the development team and they can further look into it. ( https://support.k3btg.com/a/solutions/articles/103000295705?lang=en ) Moreover,Jacob has written to Danijela Smaka CBR team to add my email address in the thread and now I am able to receive the daily sales report from CBR. if the errors are related to the missing varegruppe mapping,so the procedure can be followed in the following article. (https://support.k3btg.com/a/solutions/articles/103000283650?lang=en) if a new EDI supplier needs to be operated for a customer,the procedure can be followed in the following article. Helpdesk : K3 Support (freshdesk.com)
description:
Every normal working week day, the checks listed below are done. This is because (@Fahim - why - what's the reason for this, and impact if we don't?)

  1. a
  2. b



Fahim:
I have discussed it with Jacob and it was concluded that there are no EDI daily checks involved.
Jacob receives an excel file with status report that all the stores have received their sales data or not.
In any case,the customer itself also contacts on the same day and inform that which location is missing sales data.

According to Jacob,if a store has missed data for today due to some reasons,it should be read out anyway in the next run following the coming night.

In case,if a store is missing their sales figures so a ticket needs to be created for it and it should be send to the development team and they can further look into it. ( https://support.k3btg.com/a/solutions/articles/103000295705?lang=en )

Moreover,Jacob has written to Danijela Smaka CBR team to add my email address in the thread and now I am able to receive the daily sales report from CBR.


if the errors are related to the missing varegruppe mapping,so the procedure can be followed in the following article.
(https://support.k3btg.com/a/solutions/articles/103000283650?lang=en)

if a new EDI supplier needs to be operated for a customer,the procedure can be followed in the following article.
Helpdesk : K3 Support (freshdesk.com)

title: EDI Tools-Backoffice errors
text: In editoolbox,all supported clients can be observed regarding their backoffice error count.These errors can be reduced or vanished proactively before the customer can contact us any query regarding their itemgroups. The following link (requires support username and password) gives access to get an overview of different clients as shown in the screenshot. http://editoolbox.dddretail.com/#/ We can also observe a single client by using the tools option in the above link by entering a specific client id. As in this example,the client id is 295001 for customer BySiW Aabybro which shows backoffice errors with a total number of 20. Every store has a unique GLN(Global Location number-13 digits) which identifies a specific store location and is the first step in communicating via EDI within business. By clicking the backoffice error tab as shown in the below screenshot,different information about the errors are documented which helps in identifying the errors. In this case, we are focusing only on Fejl varegruppe EDI errors which indeed needs mapping of different items groups in EDI tool and DdD backoffice for a specific customer. The number of errors vanishes as soon the item groups are correctly mapped in EDI and DdD backoffice.The error logs can be sent to a specific email where one can get a csv file(we need only csv file with pricat information). After a specific user email is entered,the error log files are being sent to that specific email. Normally,3 files are received with information describing PRICAT,Despatch advice and OrderResponse.Here we will focus only on the file with PRICAT as shown in the below screenshot. The pricat csv is processes with data manipulation and the file shows different information about the supplier,EDI item group number,type of the product,EAN number and the type of error. Column I represents the item group number in EDI that must be match with a specific item number in DdD backoffice. Column K represents the product information and thus column X represents the item EAN code. AC shows the particular supplier for that item and AE shows specific error regarding to that item. In this case the error type is Fejl varegruppe EDI. As we have observed the EDI itemgroup numbers as shown above,the next step is to map them regarding their specific itemgroup in DdD backoffice.If there is no matching a new specific item group can be created and then mapped back with EDI itemgroup number.In such case,the new itemgroup must be communicated with the customer and should be approved by them. As shown in the below screenshot,the item groups are being matched regarding to the product type. 1703 is EDI item group which belongs to the category SkIRT and in backoffice,it can be mapped with itemgroup 72 The mapping table is shared as below. The mapping of these itemgroups according to specific supplier are done in EDI tool by using the following link and requires DdD support tools username and password in order to access the tool. https://editool.dddretail.com/EDI/EDIMainPage.aspx The setup here shows different information about EDI setup for a specific customer and an overview of list of suppliers. Please note that if an itemgroup belongs to one than more supplier,so it must be mapped to all respective suppliers. The supplier b.young is shown in this exampler and we found out from the csv file that there are 4 itemgroups for the supplier b.young. In this case, by selecting b.young,we will create 4 extra rows and enter the particular details as shown in the below image. After clicking on save mapping,the particular mappings are matched and press continue. More mapping can also be done by selecting other suppliers as Cream and Culture. When all mapping is done,we will notice that most of the backoffice errors are resolved or reduced. In order to observe that We can go back again to EDI tools for customer 295001. Click on scheduled Task as shown below and wait for a few seconds. We can observe that the number of errors are now reduced from 20 to 6.
description:
In editoolbox,all supported clients can be observed regarding their backoffice error count.These errors can be reduced or vanished proactively before the customer can contact us any query regarding their itemgroups.

The following link (requires support username and password) gives access to get an overview of different clients as shown in the screenshot.

http://editoolbox.dddretail.com/#/


We can also observe a single client by using the tools option in the above link by entering a specific client id.
As in this example,the client id is 295001 for customer BySiW Aabybro which shows backoffice errors with a total number of 20. Every store has a unique GLN(Global Location number-13 digits) which identifies a specific store location and is the first step in communicating via EDI within business.


By clicking the backoffice error tab as shown in the below screenshot,different information about the errors are documented which helps in identifying the errors.

In this case, we are focusing only on Fejl varegruppe EDI errors which indeed needs mapping of different items groups in EDI tool and DdD backoffice for a specific customer.

The number of errors vanishes as soon the item groups are correctly mapped in EDI and DdD backoffice.The error logs can be sent to a specific email where one can get a csv file(we need only csv file with pricat information).



After a specific user email is entered,the error log files are being sent to that specific email.
Normally,3 files are received with information describing PRICAT,Despatch advice and OrderResponse.Here we will focus only on the file with PRICAT as shown in the below screenshot.



The pricat csv is processes with data manipulation and the file shows different information about the supplier,EDI item group number,type of the product,EAN number and the type of error.

Column I represents the item group number in EDI that must be match with a specific item number in DdD backoffice.
Column K represents the product information and thus column X represents the item EAN code.
AC shows the particular supplier for that item and AE shows specific error regarding to that item.
In this case the error type is Fejl varegruppe EDI.




As we have observed the EDI itemgroup numbers as shown above,the next step is to map them regarding their specific itemgroup in DdD backoffice.If there is no matching a new specific item group can be created and then mapped back with EDI itemgroup number.In such case,the new itemgroup must be communicated with the customer and should be approved by them.




As shown in the below screenshot,the item groups are being matched regarding to the product type.
1703 is EDI item group which belongs to the category SkIRT and in backoffice,it can be mapped with itemgroup 72
The mapping table is shared as below.




The mapping of these itemgroups according to specific supplier are done in EDI tool by using the following link and requires DdD support tools username and password in order to access the tool.

https://editool.dddretail.com/EDI/EDIMainPage.aspx

The setup here shows different information about EDI setup for a specific customer and an overview of list of suppliers.
Please note that if an itemgroup belongs to one than more supplier,so it must be mapped to all respective suppliers.




The supplier b.young is shown in this exampler and we found out from the csv file that there are 4 itemgroups for the supplier b.young.

In this case, by selecting b.young,we will create 4 extra rows and enter the particular details as shown in the below image.
After clicking on save mapping,the particular mappings are matched and press continue.



More mapping can also be done by selecting other suppliers as Cream and Culture.

When all mapping is done,we will notice that most of the backoffice errors are resolved or reduced.
In order to observe that We can go back again to EDI tools for customer 295001.

Click on scheduled Task as shown below and wait for a few seconds.

We can observe that the number of errors are now reduced from 20 to 6.

title: EDI-Error details
text: Error description Fejl variant = the EAN is unknown, might be missing a pricat. Fejl DESADV før ORDRSP = the DESADV is missing its ORDRSP, maby the ORDRSP has failed Fejl supplier ILN = the GLN number is unknown, maby a partner is not setup. Fejl leverandør = the supplier has not been mapped Fejl varegruppe EDI = the product group is missing its mapping Fejl varegruppe EDI SAT = the product group is missing in backoffice, but the mapping is there
description:
Error description

Fejl variant = the EAN is unknown, might be missing a pricat.

Fejl DESADV før ORDRSP = the DESADV is missing its ORDRSP, maby the ORDRSP has failed

Fejl supplier ILN = the GLN number is unknown, maby a partner is not setup.

Fejl leverandør = the supplier has not been mapped

Fejl varegruppe EDI = the product group is missing its mapping

Fejl varegruppe EDI SAT = the product group is missing in backoffice, but the mapping is there

title: New supplier integration with EDI
text: The customer can contact us that they want to integrate with a new supplier using EDI. Please note that it is a payment task and should go through CSM. After approval from CSM,the process can be started. The procedure is as follows. First of all the new supplier must be operated in DdD backoffice. In this case,We are assuming supplier name Street One with a supplier number 5. We can login to EDI tool using our support login credentials with the following link. editool.dddretail.com/Login.aspx Enter the respective Group number (728 in this case) and then choose EDI type 96A and check for the available clients as shown in the below screenshot. Here,the only active store is 728002. In Order to register new supplier,Click on Insert new EDI Partner and click on Insert new EDI Partner as shown in the below screenshot. The next step is to fill the supplier details and then click on continue.The details required are Supplier GLN number,Tnr and supplier mapping(5) as from backoffice supplier number. The details for supplier Street One with id 3 is entered and make checkboxes for different options as shown below in the screenshot. Then click on Continue and the new supplier is now added to the customer in EDI tools.
description:
The customer can contact us that they want to integrate with a new supplier using EDI.
Please note that it is a payment task and should go through CSM.
After approval from CSM,the process can be started.

The procedure is as follows.

First of all the new supplier must be operated in DdD backoffice.
In this case,We are assuming supplier name Street One with a supplier number 5.


We can login to EDI tool using our support login credentials with the following link.
editool.dddretail.com/Login.aspx

Enter the respective Group number (728 in this case) and then choose EDI type 96A and check for the available clients as shown in the below screenshot.
Here,the only active store is 728002.



In Order to register new supplier,Click on Insert new EDI Partner and click on Insert new EDI Partner  as shown in the below screenshot.

The next step is to fill the supplier details and then click on continue.The details required are

Supplier GLN number,Tnr and supplier mapping(5) as from backoffice supplier number.



The details for supplier Street One with id 3 is entered and make checkboxes for different options as shown below in the screenshot.




Then click on Continue and the new supplier is now added to the customer in EDI tools.

title: How to find GLN number for a customer
text: GLN stands for Global Location Number and it is a global code that identifies a location/store electronic address. The following link (requires support username and password) gives access to get an overview of different clients as shown in the screenshot.The example here is for client id 776001 Esprit Sello. Follow the details in menu EDI information. Tnr is tracking number for Pranke. http://editoolbox.dddretail.com/#/
description:
GLN stands for Global Location Number and it is a global code that identifies a location/store electronic address.

The following link (requires support username and password) gives access to get an overview of different clients as shown in the screenshot.The example here is for client id  776001  Esprit Sello.

Follow the details in menu EDI information.
Tnr is tracking number for Pranke.


http://editoolbox.dddretail.com/#/

title: Missing PRICAT
text: Ask the supplier for the PRICAT´s i Edifact 96A Format. Check if the supplier is correctly set up in the EDI tool and if all the item groups are correctly mapped.
description:
Ask the supplier for the PRICAT´s i Edifact 96A Format. Check if the supplier is correctly set up in the EDI tool and if all the 

item groups are correctly mapped.

title: Missing ORDRSP
text: Ask the supplier for the ORDRSP´s i Edifact 96A Format.
description: Ask the supplier for the ORDRSP´s i Edifact 96A Format.

title: Missing DESADV
text: Make sure that the DESADV has his ORDRSP. Never ask the supplier to resend the DESADV or resend it internally unless you are 100 % certain that we have not received it yet.
description: Make sure that the DESADV has his ORDRSP. Never ask the supplier to resend the DESADV or resend it internally unless you are 100 % certain that we have not received it yet.

title: Missing SLSRPT
text: Make sure the sales number are in the BO. If there are no sales number in the BO, check the POS if it is online. When we have sales numbers in the BO, we most likely have received the numbers to late, so the sales numbers will be sent the very next day.
description:
Make sure the sales number are in the BO. If there are no sales number in the BO, check the POS if it is online. When we have

sales numbers in the BO, we most likely have received the numbers to late, so the sales numbers will be sent the very next day.
